---
title: "oci_invalid_no_repo.yml"
---

## High-level description
This YAML file represents an invalid configuration for OCI (Open Container Initiative) storage. It defines storage settings with OCI type and authentication credentials but lacks a required repository configuration.

## Symbols

### `storage`
#### Description
The `storage` key is the root configuration block for defining storage settings in the application.

#### Internal Logic
The `storage` block contains two sub-keys:
1. `type`: Specifies the storage type as "oci" (Open Container Initiative).
2. `oci`: Contains OCI-specific configuration details.

### `storage.type`
#### Description
Specifies the type of storage to be used.

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| type | string | The storage type, set to "oci" in this case |

### `storage.oci`
#### Description
Contains OCI-specific configuration settings.

#### Internal Logic
The `oci` block has one sub-key:
1. `authentication`: Specifies the authentication credentials for OCI storage.

### `storage.oci.authentication`
#### Description
Defines the authentication credentials for accessing OCI storage.

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| username | string | The username for OCI authentication |
| password | string | The password for OCI authentication |

## Error Handling
This configuration file is intentionally invalid due to the absence of a required repository configuration. It is likely used in test scenarios to verify proper error handling when an incomplete OCI storage configuration is provided.

## TODOs
The configuration is incomplete and invalid. To make it valid, a repository configuration should be added under the `oci` key. For example:

```yaml
storage:
  type: oci
  oci:
    repository: my-repository
    authentication:
      username: foo
      password: bar
```

This file is likely part of a test suite to ensure that the application correctly identifies and handles invalid OCI storage configurations, specifically when the repository information is missing.
